JMOP

Introducion

JMOP is Java-based music player, which works at the edge between the online and offline. It combines theese two approchaes - each track is at the first play downloaded from particular source. At the next time, it is played from the local disk.

Bacause of this it is not common player - you cannot simply pick some random track and play it in JMOP. The basic idea for the JMOP player is to simply specify some "seed" (like author name or genre) of music stream which you want to listen. The JMOP does the rest - finds music tracks related to the specified seed - possibly into infinite playlist.

Terminology

To start using JMOP, you should know some basic terms.

The root directory is simply the JMOP current working directory. It is directory at disk, where JMOP saves all bundles, playlists and tracks (see below) and possibly some configuration (there is no configuration in this version). If the root directory is not specified by command line argument, it is set to current working directory.

The bundle is just bucket of package of the music. For instance music of one author, channel or genre. Every single bundle has directory automaticaly created. This directory contains all the track files and playlist files related to the bundle. The bundle also contains "all tracks playlist" (file named all_tracks.xspf). This file is database of all tracks of the bundle and is created automatically for each bundle. Each bundle has also associated its source. The source is the portal, where all the tracks are beeing downloaded. Currently, the only YouTube.com source is supported.

Another term is playlist. Playlist is simply named list of music tracks of some bundle (playlist cannot contain tracks over various bundles). Playlist can be both unlocked or locked. Locked playlist means, that it does not grow automatically, it simply plays all the tracks and then stops. The unlocked playlist grows to infinity.

The last term is track. Track is just simply music track, song. Each track belongs to some bundle (it could be one track saved in more bundles). Track is beeing downloaded in MP3 format in the bundle directory.

Online and offline mode

One of the biggest advantage of the JMOP is the automatic switching from online to offline mode (and vice versa). When JMOP identifies internet connection issues (which probably means you are simply disconected from the internet), it automatically switches into the offline mode. In the offline mode, instead of the loading the tracks from the particular source, it simply pick random tracks from the bundle. After some time (about 1 minute) JMOP tries again to became online.

Note: Previous paragraph applies only for unlocked playlists, locked playlist behaves the regardless the mode.

Licencing and law

Warning: keep in mind that JMOP downloads authorised contents from some sources. This is not 100% legal and it could make someone mad. Please, do not distribute the downloaded music and use it only for personal purposes!

Requirements

Current version of JMOP requires two external programs to be installed. They are youtube-dl and ffmpeg. Both of them are free to download and install (youtube-dl can be downloaded here and ffmpeg here) and might be working on all major platforms. If your platform supports package manager (rpm, aptitude, ...) they might be avaible there.

If you are unsure whether theese programs are properly configured, use Help - Check configuration.

Controls

All player actions can be achieved by menu File, by big buttons at the main screen, by keyboard shortcuts or keyboard action. Keyboard shortcuts are displayed in menu, or when hovered over particular button. The most common actions (play, pause, resume) can be achieved by simply pressing space.

Configuration

There is not any configuration in current version, except the command line arguments.

Command line

JMOP can be simply configured by command line arguments. Theese arguments includes the language of the app, the root directory and even automatic play of some bundle or playlist. Particular syntax can be seen triggering command line help by running with --help flag.

Troubleshooting

Please keep in mind JMOP is primarly hobby project. There might be still some bugs and failures in the JMOP. If some error or failure occurs, try following:

  • Delete the problematic track file (if some) from the bundle directory
  • Delete the problematic track file (if some) from the .cache directory
  • Close the application and start again
  • Restart the computer and start again (in fact this might not help, but everyone tells to do that)
  • Check the log file created in the root directory
  • Contact the autor

JMOP is caching all the tracks. In some cases, the .cache directory size could increase significantly. Feel free to delete it (but better, when the application is closed).
